root_causes: Missing END IF after DO IF block (syntax and logic: the DO IF is not closed).
HidS1Group2_chk is not deleted after the LIST step (DELETE VARIABLES ... was requested).
No symmetric check for non-test mode: the code only selects invalid cases when qTesting = 1 and does not flag cases where qTesting <> 1 but HidS1Group2 is filled.
Initial COMPUTE HidS1Group2_chk = $SYSMIS is done outside the test-mode DO IF (contradicts the requirement to limit creation/computation to qTesting = 1).
instructions: Add an END IF after the conditional COMPUTE/IF statements to close the DO IF block (e.g. insert: END IF.).

Remove the outside initial COMPUTE HidS1Group2_chk = $SYSMIS; instead compute HidS1Group2_chk only within the DO IF (qTesting = 1) block, or keep initialization but ensure it does not perform substantive mapping outside the DO IF.

Change the SEL IF selection to enforce the symmetric logic: select rows where (qTesting = 1 and (MISSING(HidS1Group2) OR HidS1Group2 < 1 OR HidS1Group2 > 2 OR HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2)) OR (qTesting <> 1 and NOT MISSING(HidS1Group2)). Example: sel if ((qTesting = 1 and ( MISSING(HidS1Group2) or HidS1Group2 < 1 or HidS1Group2 > 2 or HidS1Group2_chk <> HidS1Group2 )) or (qTesting <> 1 and not missing(HidS1Group2))).
After the LIST statement add DELETE VARIABLES HidS1Group2_chk. This ensures the temporary check variable is removed from the dataset.

root_causes: The computed helper variable HidS1Group1_chk is never used â€” there is no comparison between HidS1Group1 and HidS1Group1_chk to detect mapping mismatches.
The script only performs an invalid-code check (flags HidS1Group1 values not in 1,2,3,97,98,99) but does not implement the required mapping comparison for cases where HidS1Group1 is coded 1-3.
HidS1Group1_chk is deleted at the end but was not used, so the mapping check requirement is unfulfilled.
instructions:
After computing HidS1Group1_chk from SPECIALTY, add a check that selects non-missing records where HidS1Group1 is in 1-3 and differs from HidS1Group1_chk, then list respid, HidS1Group1, HidS1Group1_chk and SPECIALTY. Example SPSS lines to insert before deleting the helper var:
	temporary.
	sel if (not miss(HidS1Group1) & any(HidS1Group1,1,2,3) & HidS1Group1 ~= HidS1Group1_chk).
	list respid HidS1Group1 HidS1Group1_chk SPECIALTY.
Keep the existing invalid-code test for non-missing cases (to catch values not in 1,2,3,97,98,99). If you want both checks, run them separately (each within its own temporary selection) before deleting HidS1Group1_chk. Example:
	temporary.
	sel if (not miss(HidS1Group1) & not any(HidS1Group1,1,2,3,97,98,99)).
	list respid HidS1Group1 SPECIALTY.
Do not delete HidS1Group1_chk until after both the mapping-mismatch list and the invalid-code list have been produced (i.e., move 'del var HidS1Group1_chk.' to after the new checks).

root_causes: System-missing HidS1Group2 responses will be flagged because the sel if condition does not exclude missing values. any(HidS1Group2,...) returns false for system-missing, so not any(...) evaluates true and selects missing cases.
Sel-if should only flag non-missing responses that are not in the allowed codes; current logic flags missing rows.
instructions: Change the sel if line to exclude system-missing values. For example: sel if isTest() & not miss(HidS1Group2) & ( not any(HidS1Group2,1,2,97,98,99) ).
Keep acceptance of special codes 97, 98, 99 and the list statement as-is (list respid HidS1Group2 SPECIALTY).
